definition: to bear/to carry/to hold/to continue/to undertake/to take charge/owing to/due to/to receive
surname Cheng/Cheng (c. 2000 BC), third of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
to carry/to convey/to load/to hold/to fill up/and/also/as well as/simultaneously
to record in writing/to carry (i.e. publish in a newspaper etc)/Taiwan pr. [zai4]/year
capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word

sentences.english: It is running out of channel capacity so fast.
sentences.chinese: 它的频道承载量快速呈现不足。

sentences.english: Our machine weighs only but 500 kilograms.
sentences.chinese: 我们的机器承载量只有500公斤。

sentences.english: In this paper, a finite-element method is used to calculate pressure distribution and load capacity.
sentences.chinese: 本文用有限元法计算厂轴承的膜压分布及承载量。

sentences.english: Stable operation, heavy capacity, exact location and convenient maintainence.
sentences.chinese: 运行平稳，承载量大，定位准确，维修方便。

sentences.english: Our class is studying the carrying capacity of small forests.
sentences.chinese: 我们班正在研究小面积林地的生物承载量。

sentences.english: A rider should estimate his load on a donkey in order not to make it restive.
sentences.chinese: 骑者应该估量一下驴的承载量，一边可以驾驭它。

definition: dead weight/weight capacity of a vehicle
to hold/to contain/to accommodate/to tolerate (different opinions)
